member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.ICanvasBrush
member.summary: A brush defines the color of things being drawn. It can be a solid color, or a bitmap pattern, or a gradient.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.ICanvasBrush.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity of the brush.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.ICanvasBrush.Transform
member.summary: Gets or sets the brush transform matrix.

remarks.p: To align the content of an bitmap brush to the area being painted, you can use the Transform property to translate the bitmap to the desired location. This transform only affects the brush; it does not affect any other content drawn by the render target.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.ICanvasBrush.Device
member.summary: The device associated with this brush.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasSolidColorBrush
member.summary: The simplest kind of brush. Paints things a solid color.

remarks.p: When using Direct2D interop, this Win2D class corresponds to the Direct2D interface ID2D1SolidColorBrush.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasSolidColorBrush.#ctor(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.ICanvasResourceCreator,Windows.UI.Color)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CanvasSolidColorBrush class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasSolidColorBrush.CreateHdr(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.ICanvasResourceCreator,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CanvasSolidColorBrush class using a specified high-dynamic-range color.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasSolidColorBrush.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the CanvasSolidColorBrush.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasSolidColorBrush.Transform
member.summary: Gets or sets the brush transform matrix.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasSolidColorBrush.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity of the brush.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasSolidColorBrush.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the brush.
member.remarks:
If the color was previously set using to a value that cannot be represented by a Windows.UI.Color then the value returned by this method is clamped. For example:
brush.ColorHdr = new Vector4(2.0f, 2.0f, 2.0f, 2.0f); var color = brush.Color; // color is 255, 255, 255, 255.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasSolidColorBrush.ColorHdr
member.summary: Gets or sets the high-dynamic-range color of the brush.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasSolidColorBrush.Device
member.summary: The device associated with this brush.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasImageBrush
member.summary: A brush which paints using image content, such as a bitmap. Useful for producing tiled backgrounds, or filling geometry with a pattern.

remarks.p: When using Direct2D interop, this Win2D class corresponds to the Direct2D interface ID2D1BitmapBrush1 (if Image is a CanvasBitmap and SourceRectangle is null) or ID2D1ImageBrush (if Image is any other type of ICanvasImage, or if SourceRectangle is set).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasImageBrush.#ctor(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.ICanvasResourceCreator)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CanvasImageBrush class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasImageBrush.#ctor(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.ICanvasResourceCreator,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.ICanvasImage)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CanvasImageBrush class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasImageBrush.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the CanvasImageBrush.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasImageBrush.SourceRectangle
member.summary: Optional field which specifies the source rectangle of the brush.
member.remarks: If no source rectangle is specified- that is, this property is set to null- then the entire source image is used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasImageBrush.Interpolation
member.summary: Specifies the image quality used for resizing and transforms.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasImageBrush.Image
member.summary: Specifies an image used for the brush.
member.remarks: This property is allowed to be set to null. However, it must be set to non-null whenever the brush is used for drawing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasImageBrush.ExtendY
member.summary: Specifies how content is tiled vertically when it extends beyond the Image.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasImageBrush.ExtendX
member.summary: Specifies how content is tiled horizontally when it extends beyond the Image.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasImageBrush.Transform
member.summary: Specifies a transform used for this brush. The default transform is identity.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasImageBrush.Opacity
member.summary: Specifies an opacity level used for this brush. The default is fully opaque.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasImageBrush.Device
member.summary: The device associated with this brush.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasAlphaMode
member.summary: Specifies the way in which an alpha channel affects color channels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasAlphaMode.Premultiplied
member.summary: The alpha value has been premultiplied. In blending, each color is scaled by the alpha value. Note that the alpha value itself is the same in both straight and premultiplied alpha. Typically, no color channel value is greater than the alpha channel value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasAlphaMode.Straight
member.summary: The alpha channel indicates the transparency of the color.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasAlphaMode.Ignore
member.summary: The alpha value is ignored.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBufferPrecision
member.summary: Specifies the bit depth used for graphical computations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBufferPrecision.Precision8UIntNormalized
member.summary: Use 8-bit normalized integer per channel.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBufferPrecision.Precision8UIntNormalizedSrgb
member.summary: Use 8-bit normalized integer standard RGB data per channel.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBufferPrecision.Precision16UIntNormalized
member.summary: Use 16-bit normalized integer per channel.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBufferPrecision.Precision16Float
member.summary: Use 16-bit floats per channel.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBufferPrecision.Precision32Float
member.summary: Use 32-bit floats per channel.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasColorSpace
member.summary: Specifies options that should be applied to the color space.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasColorSpace.Custom
member.summary: The color space is a custom ICC .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasColorSpace.Srgb
member.summary: The color space is sRGB.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasColorSpace.ScRgb
member.summary: The color space is scRGB.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasGradientStop
member.summary: Used to describe one gradient stop in a gradient brush.
member.remarks: See for a version that accepts high-dynamic-range colors.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasGradientStop.Position
member.summary: The position of the gradient stop. Expected to be between 0 and 1, inclusive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasGradientStop.Color
member.summary: The color at the gradient stop.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasGradientStopHdr
member.summary: Used to describe one high-dynamic-range gradient stop in a gradient brush.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasGradientStopHdr.Position
member.summary: The position of the gradient stop. Expected to be between 0 and 1, inclusive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasGradientStopHdr.Color
member.summary: The color at the gradient stop.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasLinearGradientBrush
member.summary: A brush used to paint a linear gradient.

remarks.p: When using Direct2D interop, this Win2D class corresponds to the Direct2D interface ID2D1LinearGradientBrush.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasLinearGradientBrush.#ctor(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.ICanvasResourceCreator,Windows.UI.Color,Windows.UI.Color)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CanvasLinearGradientBrush class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasLinearGradientBrush.#ctor(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.ICanvasResourceCreator,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasGradientStop[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CanvasLinearGradientBrush class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasLinearGradientBrush.#ctor(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.ICanvasResourceCreator,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasGradientStop[],Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasEdgeBehavior,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasAlphaMode)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CanvasLinearGradientBrush class.
Initializes a new instance of the CanvasLinearGradientBrush class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasLinearGradientBrush.CreateHdr(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.ICanvasResourceCreator,System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CanvasLinearGradientBrush class using high-dynamic-range colors.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasLinearGradientBrush.CreateHdr(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.ICanvasResourceCreator,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasGradientStopHdr[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CanvasLinearGradientBrush class using high-dynamic-range colors.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasLinearGradientBrush.CreateHdr(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.ICanvasResourceCreator,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasGradientStopHdr[],Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasEdgeBehavior,Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasAlphaMode)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CanvasLinearGradientBrush class using high-dynamic-range colors.
Initializes a new instance of the CanvasLinearGradientBrush class using high-dynamic-range colors.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasLinearGradientBrush.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the CanvasLinearGradientBrush.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasLinearGradientBrush.CreateRainbow(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.ICanvasResourceCreator,System.Single)
member.summary: A convenience for producing a rainbow-colored gradient.

param.name: eldritchness
param.i:
Zero for a unicorny rainbow of gladness,
One for Seattle style depressing gray and sadness.
Since this value is a float,
you may use fractional values to denote,
sheens inbetween.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasLinearGradientBrush.Transform
member.summary: The transform affecting the brush.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasLinearGradientBrush.Opacity
member.summary: The opacity affecting the brush.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasLinearGradientBrush.StartPoint
member.summary: The point on the canvas on which the gradient starts.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasLinearGradientBrush.EndPoint
member.summary: The point on the canvas on which the gradient stops.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasLinearGradientBrush.AlphaMode
member.summary: Specifies the treatment of alpha.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasLinearGradientBrush.BufferPrecision
member.summary: Specifies the precision used for computation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasLinearGradientBrush.EdgeBehavior
member.summary: Specifies the behavior for pixels which fall outside of the gradient's typical rendering area.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasLinearGradientBrush.PostInterpolationSpace
member.summary: Specifies the color space to be used before interpolation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasLinearGradientBrush.PreInterpolationSpace
member.summary: Specifies the color space to be used after interpolation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasLinearGradientBrush.Stops
member.summary: Gets the gradient stops that comprise the brush.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasLinearGradientBrush.StopsHdr
member.summary: Gets the high-dynamic-range gradient stops that comprise the brush.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasLinearGradientBrush.Device
member.summary: The device associated with this brush.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasRadialGradientBrush
member.summary: A brush used to paint a radial gradient.

remarks.p: When using Direct2D interop, this Win2D class corresponds to the Direct2D interface ID2D1RadialGradientBrush.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasRadialGradientBrush.RadiusY
member.summary: Specifies the vertical radius of the brush's radial gradient.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Brushes.CanvasRadialGradientBrush.OriginOffset
member.summary: Specifies a displacement from Center, used to form the brush's radial gradient.

member.summary: Specifies the center of the brush's radial gradient
